nodes.text: Bakkar

Bakkar, nicknamed "the Butcher," was a human male who owned the restaurant Ronto Roasters in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. A big fan of podracing, Bakkar originally hailed from the planet Tatooine and came from a family that worked as butchers for four generations. Bakkar opened his restaurant after moving to Batuu with his pitmaster droid, 8D-J8. In 34 ABY, 8D-J8's reprogramming that intended to make the droid man the grill also resulted in his talking too much; in order to solve the issue, Bakkar contacted the Utai Mubo, who eventually agreed to help fix the droid.
Biography
Opening a restaurant

Bakkar was a fourth-generation butcher grew up on the planet Tatooine, where his family's specialty was the ronto creature. He was a big fan of the podracing sport even after it was outlawed across the galaxy. After leaving Tatooine, the pitmaster droid 8D-J8 never left his side. He moved to the planet Batuu, where he opened a restaurant called Ronto Roasters in the settlement Black Spire Outpost in order to bring the ronto to new customers. 8D-J8 accompanied him to Batuu, serving as the pitmaster of the restaurant, where he was programmed to turn the spit and make sure that the meats were grilled well. Bakkar employed several others to help run the establishment along side the droid. He used a large podracing engine as the grill for Ronto Roasters, which he had salvaged and subsequently hung from the ceiling. Due to his becoming a butcher, Bakkar was aptly nicknamed "the Butcher."

Bakkar and his pitmaster sold several meats and vegetables at Ronto Roasters, but the establishment's best-selling dish at was the Ronto Wrap, which was made with his signature sauce, Clutch Sauce. Ronto Roasters also sold drinks, with Bakkar's signature beverage being the Tatooine Sunset. On multiple occasions, Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs had tried to persuade Bakkar to share his family's secret spice rub for ronto wraps, but Bakkar always refused. Tuggs respected it being a secret, but he still tried to figure out the recipe for himself.

At some point after the Battle of Takodana of 34 ABY, Tuggs published a cookbook, The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook. In the book, he discussed Bakkar and his secret recipe while also proclaiming that Bakkar's stand in Black Spire Outpost had the "most delicious" meat one could find in the Outer Rim Territories. The historian Eloc Throno also discussed Bakkar's restaurant and signature dishes in his book Traveler's Guide to Batuu, where he recommended the food there. Bakkar Spire, a location in Black Spire Outpost, shared its name with Bakkar.
A troublesome droid

In 34 ABY, Bakkar messaged the Utai droid builder Mubo, as he was frustrated with Mubo's reprogramming of 8D-J8. Mubo insisted that his job had been done correctly, as the droid turned the spit, but Bakkar told him that his droid refused to stop talking. Mubo asked if Bakkar had tried deactivating and reactivating him in order to fix the issue.

Mubo then reminded Bakkar that he had already reprogrammed 8D-J8 several times, and that Bakkar was simply never pleased with the results. Bakkar insisted that another reprogramming was necessary, or else he would need to fasten a restraining bolt onto the droid. Mubo beseeched him not to put a bolt on the pitmaster, but Bakkar pointed out that 8D-J8 had begun thinking himself to be a droid chef, and that due to his simply being a pitmaster, he needed to stop talking. Mubo relented, and despite his being swamped with orders, he told Bakkar that he would stop by later.
Personality and traits

Bakkar had a love for podracing and was willing to talk about it at length. When the reprogramming of his droid resulted in his constant talking, it became too much for him, and even though the programmer Mubo resisted to performing yet another reprogramming on 8D-J8, Bakkar's threat of using a restraining bolt on him forced the Utai to give in. He was a human male with light skin and light-colored hair.
Skills and abilities

Bakkar was a skilled chef, having been a fourth-generation butcher. His dishes were praised in both Traveler's Guide to Batuu and The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook. The latter noted, however, that it was possible that most of the credit could be given to 8D-J8.
Equipment
Bakkar utilized a podracer engine in place of a traditional cooking grill. He wore blue clothing covered by red-brown robes along with a brown hat.
Behind the scenes

Bakkar was created as part of the backstory for the real-world Ronto Roasters restaurant at the Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge theme park, which  opened in 2019 at Disneyland Park and Disney's Hollywood Studios Park. He then made a full appearance in the Star Wars: Datapad app, where he was also pictured for the first time.

Although Star Wars: Datapad depicted Bakkar as a man with short, light colored hair, he was depicted with long, brown hair in the 2019 recipe book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook. As Datapad uses a live-action image instead of an artistic one, like used in The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, this article presents the former's as the canonical depiction.
